did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Material documenting the shows and operations of the Cornell Concert Commission mostly from 1971-1992, includes tour riders, posters, advertising material, and scrapbooks.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Material documenting the shows and operations of the Cornell Concert Commission mostly from 1971-1992, includes tour riders, posters, advertising material, and scrapbooks.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell Concert Commission records #37-7-3832. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Includes tour riders, publicity material, correspondence, financial records, crew lists, newspaper clippings, and show advertisments
Tour rider includes clause emphasizing no all white audiences
Includes notes on incidents during show

did.unittitle: Paul Simon; Urubama; Jesse Dixon Singers
Sly & the Family Stone; the Wailers

scopecontent.p: Press release regarding show cancellation, mentions financial settlement discussions from Deep Purple show
Cancelled

did.unittitle: Creative Source; Voices of East Harlem; New Birth

scopecontent.p: Miles Davis cancelled

did.unittitle: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
New Riders of the Purple Sage

scopecontent.p: Tour rider includes suggestion to hire "two ladies" to serve as hostesses
Includes note about "the ridiculous audience control pattern"
Tour rider includes detailed food requests
Cancelled
Tour rider includes request for 500 lbs. of dry ice
Tour rider includes request for 350 lbs. of dry ice; emphasis placed on organic foods
Includes concert t-shirt sketches

did.unittitle: Southside Johnny and the Asbury Jukes

scopecontent.p: Wet Willie; Stanky Brown
Cancelled
Includes flyers advertising WVBR's Romeo and Juliet contest to pair up strangers for dinner and the concert
Tour rider includes clause refusing to perform before audiences segregated on the basis of race, color, creed or sex
Includes memo detailing injuries from this concert and Kinks show

did.unittitle: Echo & the Bunnymen; the Leather Nun

scopecontent.p: Tour rider prohibits "Slam Dancing and Stage Diving".

Student Assembly commends Cornell Concert Commission, claiming "the group stirred up more excitement on campus than any group has in yearsâ€¦ you have quieted, for a time, the many students who clamor for big-name bands to come on campus". Enclosed is a form detailing a poster violation filed by the Robert Purcell Union (along with copy of offending poster).
Tracy Chapman had "just concluded performing with the Amnesty International Tour all over the world, and [had] scheduled only five shoes in the Western Hemisphere, one of which is at Cornell".
Contract prohibits the presence of a piano "in the artist's suite".
Includes ballot for election of Cornell Concert Commission Executive Board.

did.unittitle: Edie Bricknell & New Bohemians; Steve Forbert

scopecontent.p: Concert was co-presented by the Third World Student Programming Board.
Performers: the Toasters; the Feelies; Includes two 7" vinyl records featuring The Toaster's "Talk Is Cheap", and a letter discussing the possibility of hosting a summer venue at Schoelkopf Field.
Artist specifically agreed to perform, "An Evening With" (see additional provisions in contract).
Performers: Third World; Soul Jahs; bop (harvey)

did.unittitle: The Alarm; The Kevin McDermott Orchestra

scopecontent.p: Includes letter detailing a theft that took place after the concert, and very detailed advertising routes for Cornell Concert Commission members.

did.unittitle: Robert Fripp & The League of Crafty Guitarists

scopecontent.p: Includes letter describing artist's appreciation for Cornell University's excellent hospitality and cetering services, and index cards with reviews of the concert

Includes information regarding the MTV Save the Earth Campaign; stickers from the event, a copy of the April edition of MTV To Go, along with an essay of sorts titled "CIJ on being a woman in the music industry" .
Performer: NBRQ, Cancelled
The Joe Ely tour rider explicitly demands "no insects or animal organs - please!"
Cancelled

did.unittitle: Timothy Wright (and the Concert Choir); The Wade Sisters, Lorraine Stancil
Boogie Down Productions; Ed O.G.; Da Bulldogs

scopecontent.p: Commercial thirty seconds in length was broadcasted on MTV and ESPN sometime between 6 AM and midnight
Original date of concert April 23, 1991 was cancelled, reschedule form does not indicate new date

did.unittitle: Bernie Milton and the Soul Patrol

scopecontent.p: Involved collaboration between Cornell Concert Commission and the Festival of Black Gospel Committee; cancelled because record label did not respond in time. Includes resume of William David Stewart, a gospel singer. Enclosed is a letter from the Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority requesting funds to host "The Boy's Choir of Harlem".

did.unittitle: Naughty by Nature, Queen Latifah, and Blacksheep

scopecontent.p: The Flavor Unit Tour
Performers: Violent Femmes, Fishbone, Blue yster Cult, and Tribe. Transcripts of WJPZ Syracuse radio broadcasts of this event are included.
Includes an investigation report detailing two incidents involving minors; "the seventeen year old has a possible broken ankleâ€¦ [and] the sixteen year old was kicked in the headâ€¦"

Includes Elton John. Jason, Blood Sweat and Tears, Beach Boys, The Byrds, Herbie Hancock, Miles Davis, Bobby Byrd and the JB's, Mahavishnu Orchestra, Loggins and Messina, Deep Purple has information about the riot during the show.
Includes various acts, some clippings for concerts from performers who came to Cornell, but not necessarily for their Cornell performance.

Includes Joni Mitchell, Yes, Four Tops, Jefferson Starship, The Mahavishnu Orchestra and Weather Report, Judy Collins, Paul Simon, Sly and the Family Stone, David Crosby and Graham Nash, The Band with Aztec Two-Step, Santana, Taj Mahal with Minnie Ripperton, Return to Forever with Chick Corea, The Eleventh House with Larry Coryell, Billy Joel.
Includes Linda Ronstadt, Renaissance, New Riders of the Purple Sage, Grateful Dead.
Includes Stanley Jordan, Lady Smith Black Mambazo with Samite, Edie Brickell and New Bohemians, Tito Puente and De La Soul.
Count: 3
Count: 3

The Mahavishnu Orchestra with John McLaughlin

scopecontent.p: Accounts written in 2016 describe May 8, 1977 concert
Reprint photos of May 8, 1977 concert at Barton Hall
